text: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom the word of the Lord came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah king of Judah, unto the carrying away of Jerusalem captive in the fifth month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Then said I, Ah, Lord God! behold, I cannot speak: for I am a child.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said unto me, Say not, I am a child: for thou shalt go to all that I shall send thee, and whatsoever I command thee thou shalt speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not afraid of their faces: for I am with thee to deliver thee, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord put forth his hand, and touched my mouth. And the Lord said unto me, Behold, I have put my words in thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: See, I have this day set thee over the nations and over the kingdoms, to root out, and to pull down, and to destroy, and to throw down, to build, and to plant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the word of the Lord came unto me, saying, Jeremiah, what seest thou? And I said, I see a rod of an almond tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord unto me, Thou hast well seen: for I will hasten my word to perform it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came unto me the second time, saying, What seest thou? And I said, I see a seething pot; and the face thereof is toward the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto me, Out of the north an evil shall break forth upon all the inhabitants of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, I will call all the families of the kingdoms of the north, saith the Lord; and they shall come, and they shall set every one his throne at the entering of the gates of Jerusalem, and against all the walls thereof round about, and against all the cities of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, who have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, and worshipped the works of their own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou therefore gird up thy loins, and arise, and speak unto them all that I command thee: be not dismayed at their faces, lest I confound thee before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, behold, I have made thee this day a defenced city, and an iron pillar, and brasen walls against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, against the princes thereof, against the priests thereof, and against the people of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail against thee; for I am with thee, saith the Lord, to deliver thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith the Lord;
I remember thee, the kindness of thy youth,
the love of thine espousals,
when thou wentest after me in the wilderness,
in a land that was not sown.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel was holiness unto the Lord,
and the firstfruits of his increase:
all that devour him shall offend;
evil shall come upon them, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear ye the word of the Lord,
O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord,
What iniquity have your fathers found in me,
that they are gone far from me,
and have walked after vanity, and are become vain?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Neither said they, Where is the Lord
that brought us up out of the land of Egypt,
that led us through the wilderness,
through a land of deserts and of pits,
through a land of drought, and of the shadow of death,
through a land that no man passed through,
and where no man dwelt?
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I brought you into a plentiful country,
to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof;
but when ye entered, ye defiled my land,
and made mine heritage an abomination.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The priests said not, Where is the Lord?
and they that handle the law knew me not:
the pastors also transgressed against me,
and the prophets prophesied by Baal,
and walked after things that do not profit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wherefore I will yet plead with you, saith the Lord,
and with your children’s children will I plead.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hath a nation changed their gods, which are yet no gods?
but my people have changed their glory
for that which doth not profit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this,
and be horribly afraid,
be ye very desolate, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my people have committed two evils;
they have forsaken me the fountain of living waters,
and hewed them out cisterns,
broken cisterns, that can hold no water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is Israel a servant? is he a homeborn slave?
why is he spoiled?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The young lions roared upon him,
and yelled, and they made his land waste:
his cities are burned without inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the children of Noph and Tahapanes have broken the crown of thy head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hast thou not procured this unto thyself,
in that thou hast forsaken the Lord thy God,
when he led thee by the way?
speaker: Narrator

text:
And now what hast thou to do in the way of Egypt,
to drink the waters of Sihor?
or what hast thou to do in the way of Assyria,
to drink the waters of the river?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thine own wickedness shall correct thee,
and thy backslidings shall reprove thee:
know therefore and see that it is an evil thing and bitter,
that thou hast forsaken the Lord thy God,
and that my fear is not in thee, saith the Lord God of hosts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Yet I had planted thee a noble vine, wholly a right seed:
how then art thou turned into the degenerate plant of a strange vine unto me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For though thou wash thee with nitre,
and take thee much soap,
yet thine iniquity is marked before me, saith the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How canst thou say, I am not polluted,
I have not gone after Baalim?
see thy way in the valley,
know what thou hast done:
thou art a swift dromedary traversing her ways;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Withhold thy foot from being unshod,
and thy throat from thirst:
but thou saidst, There is no hope:
no; for I have loved strangers, and after them will I go.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the thief is ashamed when he is found,
so is the house of Israel ashamed;
they, their kings, their princes,
and their priests, and their prophets,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Wherefore will ye plead with me?
ye all have transgressed against me, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In vain have I smitten your children;
they received no correction:
your own sword hath devoured your prophets,
like a destroying lion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O generation, see ye the word of the Lord.
Have I been a wilderness unto Israel?
a land of darkness?
wherefore say my people, We are lords;
we will come no more unto thee?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can a maid forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire?
yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why trimmest thou thy way to seek love?
therefore hast thou also taught the wicked ones thy ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents:
I have not found it by secret search, but upon all these.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet thou sayest, Because I am innocent,
surely his anger shall turn from me.
Behold, I will plead with thee,
because thou sayest, I have not sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why gaddest thou about so much to change thy way?
thou also shalt be ashamed of Egypt,
as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yea, thou shalt go forth from him,
and thine hands upon thine head:
for the Lord hath rejected thy confidences,
and thou shalt not prosper in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They say, If a man put away his wife,
and she go from him, and become another man’s,
shall he return unto her again?
shall not that land be greatly polluted?
but thou hast played the harlot with many lovers;
yet return again to me, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up thine eyes unto the high places,
and see where thou hast not been lien with.
In the ways hast thou sat for them,
as the Arabian in the wilderness;
and thou hast polluted the land
with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the showers have been withholden,
and there hath been no latter rain;
and thou hadst a whore’s forehead,
thou refusedst to be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me,
My father, thou art the guide of my youth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will he reserve his anger for ever?
will he keep it to the end?
Behold, thou hast spoken and done evil things as thou couldest.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said also unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I said after she had done all these things, Turn thou unto me. But she returned not. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I saw, when for all the causes whereby backsliding Israel committed adultery I had put her away, and given her a bill of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah feared not, but went and played the harlot also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that she defiled the land, and committed adultery with stones and with stocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not turned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto me, The backsliding Israel hath justified herself more than treacherous Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the Lord; and I will not cause mine anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful, saith the Lord, and I will not keep anger for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against the Lord thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn, O backsliding children, saith the Lord; for I am married unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion:
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when ye be multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith the Lord, they shall say no more, The ark of the covenant of the Lord: neither shall it come to mind: neither shall they remember it; neither shall they visit it; neither shall that be done any more.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the Lord; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the imagination of their evil heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, How shall I put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of nations? and I said, Thou shalt call me, My father; and shalt not turn away from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice was heard upon the high places, weeping and supplications of the children of Israel: for they have perverted their way, and they have forgotten the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Return, ye backsliding children, and I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we come unto thee: for thou art the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, and from the multitude of mountains: truly in the Lord our God is the salvation of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For shame hath devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: We lie down in our shame, and our confusion covereth us: for we have sinned against the Lord our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day, and have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the Lord, return unto me:
and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight,
then shalt thou not remove.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And thou shalt swear, The Lord liveth,
in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness;
and the nations shall bless themselves in him,
and in him shall they glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus saith the Lord to the men of Judah and Jerusalem,
Break up your fallow ground,
and sow not among thorns.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Circumcise yourselves to the Lord,
and take away the foreskins of your heart,
ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem:
lest my fury come forth like fire,
and burn that none can quench it,
because of the evil of your doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem;
and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land:
cry, gather together, and say,
Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the defenced cities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Set up the standard toward Zion:
retire, stay not:
for I will bring evil from the north,
and a great destruction.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl:
for the fierce anger of the Lord is not turned back from us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the Lord,
that the heart of the king shall perish,
and the heart of the princes;
and the priests shall be astonished,
and the prophets shall wonder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then said I, Ah, Lord God!
surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem,
saying, Ye shall have peace;
whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem,
A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness
toward the daughter of my people,
not to fan, nor to cleanse,
speaker: Narrator

text:
even a full wind from those places shall come unto me:
now also will I give sentence against them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, he shall come up as clouds,
and his chariots shall be as a whirlwind:
his horses are swifter than eagles.
Woe unto us! for we are spoiled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness,
that thou mayest be saved.
How long shall thy vain thoughts lodge within thee?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a voice declareth from Dan,
and publisheth affliction from mount Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make ye mention to the nations;
behold, publish against Jerusalem,
that watchers come from a far country,
and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As keepers of a field, are they against her round about;
because she hath been rebellious against me, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
How long shall I see the standard,
and hear the sound of the trumpet?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my people is foolish, they have not known me;
they are sottish children,
and they have none understanding:
they are wise to do evil,
but to do good they have no knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was without form, and void;
and the heavens, and they had no light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled,
and all the hills moved lightly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I beheld, and, lo, there was no man,
and all the birds of the heavens were fled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful place was a wilderness,
and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of the Lord,
and by his fierce anger.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For this shall the earth mourn,
and the heavens above be black:
because I have spoken it, I have purposed it,
and will not repent, neither will I turn back from it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And when thou art spoiled, what wilt thou do?
Though thou clothest thyself with crimson,
though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold,
though thou rentest thy face with painting,
in vain shalt thou make thyself fair;
thy lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail,
and the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child,
the voice of the daughter of Zion, that bewaileth herself,
that spreadeth her hands, saying,
Woe is me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem,
and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof,
if ye can find a man, if there be any that executeth judgment,
that seeketh the truth; and I will pardon it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And though they say, The Lord liveth;
surely they swear falsely.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them,
and a wolf of the evenings shall spoil them,
a leopard shall watch over their cities:
every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces:
because their transgressions are many,
and their backslidings are increased.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How shall I pardon thee for this?
thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods:
when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery,
and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They were as fed horses in the morning:
every one neighed after his neighbour’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall I not visit for these things? saith the Lord:
and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the house of Israel and the house of Judah
have dealt very treacherously against me, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
and the prophets shall become wind,
and the word is not in them:
thus shall it be done unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wherefore thus saith the Lord God of hosts,
Because ye speak this word,
behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire,
and this people wood, and it shall devour them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far,
O house of Israel, saith the Lord:
it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation,
a nation whose language thou knowest not,
neither understandest what they say.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their quiver is as an open sepulchre,
they are all mighty men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they shall eat up thine harvest, and thy bread,
which thy sons and thy daughters should eat:
they shall eat up thy flocks and thine herds:
they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig trees:
they shall impoverish thy fenced cities,
wherein thou trustedst, with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless in those days, saith the Lord, I will not make a full end with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore doeth the Lord our God all these things unto us? then shalt thou answer them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served strange gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land that is not yours.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare this in the house of Jacob,
and publish it in Judah, saying,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
fear ye not me? saith the Lord:
will ye not tremble at my presence,
which have placed the sand for the bound of the sea
by a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it:
and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail;
though they roar, yet can they not pass over it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart;
they are revolted and gone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Neither say they in their heart,
Let us now fear the Lord our God,
that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in his season:
he reserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your iniquities have turned away these things,
and your sins have withholden good things from you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit:
therefore they are become great, and waxen rich.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are waxen fat, they shine:
yea, they overpass the deeds of the wicked:
they judge not the cause, the cause of the fatherless, yet they prosper;
and the right of the needy do they not judge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall I not visit for these things? saith the Lord:
shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
speaker: Narrator

text: A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the land;
speaker: Narrator

text:
the prophets prophesy falsely,
and the priests bear rule by their means;
and my people love to have it so:
and what will ye do in the end thereof?
speaker: Narrator

text:
O ye children of Benjamin, gather yourselves
to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem,
and blow the trumpet in Tekoa,
and set up a sign of fire in Beth-haccerem:
for evil appeareth out of the north, and great destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have likened the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate woman.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Prepare ye war against her;
arise, and let us go up at noon.
Woe unto us! for the day goeth away,
for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, and let us go by night,
and let us destroy her palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus hath the Lord of hosts said,
Hew ye down trees, and cast a mount against Jerusalem:
this is the city to be visited;
she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord of hosts,
They shall throughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine:
turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer into the baskets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear?
behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken:
behold, the word of the Lord is unto them a reproach;
they have no delight in it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And their houses shall be turned unto others,
with their fields and wives together:
for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them
every one is given to covetousness;
and from the prophet even unto the priest
every one dealeth falsely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have healed also the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly,
saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination?
nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush:
therefore they shall fall among them that fall:
at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord, Stand ye in the ways,
and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way,
and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls.
But they said, We will not walk therein.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also I set watchmen over you, saying,
Hearken to the sound of the trumpet.
But they said, We will not hearken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore hear, ye nations,
and know, O congregation, what is among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people,
even the fruit of their thoughts,
because they have not hearkened unto my words,
nor to my law, but rejected it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To what purpose cometh there to me incense from Sheba,
and the sweet cane from a far country?
your burnt offerings are not acceptable,
nor your sacrifices sweet unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus saith the Lord,
Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people,
and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them;
the neighbour and his friend shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord,
Behold, a people cometh from the north country,
and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
We have heard the fame thereof: our hands wax feeble:
anguish hath taken hold of us,
and pain, as of a woman in travail.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way;
for the sword of the enemy and fear is on every side.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth,
and wallow thyself in ashes:
make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation:
for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have set thee for a tower and a fortress among my people,
that thou mayest know and try their way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are all grievous revolters, walking with slanders:
they are brass and iron; they are all corrupters.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Reprobate silver shall men call them,
because the Lord hath rejected them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand in the gate of the Lord’s house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of the Lord, all ye of Judah, that enter in at these gates to worship the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, Amend your ways and your doings, and I will cause you to dwell in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust ye not in lying words, saying, The temple of the Lord, The temple of the Lord, The temple of the Lord, are these.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye throughly amend your ways and your doings; if ye throughly execute judgment between a man and his neighbour;
speaker: Narrator

text: if ye oppress not the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed not innocent blood in this place, neither walk after other gods to your hurt:
speaker: Narrator

text: then will I cause you to dwell in this place, in the land that I gave to your fathers, for ever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, ye trust in lying words, that cannot profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense unto Baal, and walk after other gods whom ye know not;
speaker: Narrator

text: and come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, We are delivered to do all these abominations?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, even I have seen it, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go ye now unto my place which was in Shiloh, where I set my name at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, because ye have done all these works, saith the Lord, and I spake unto you, rising up early and speaking, but ye heard not; and I called you, but ye answered not;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore will I do unto this house, which is called by my name, wherein ye trust, and unto the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I have done to Shiloh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brethren, even the whole seed of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me: for I will not hear thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seest thou not what they do in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
speaker: Narrator

text: The children gather wood, and the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead their dough, to make cakes to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offerings unto other gods, that they may provoke me to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do they provoke me to anger? saith the Lord: do they not provoke themselves to the confusion of their own faces?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God; Behold, mine anger and my fury shall be poured out upon this place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the trees of the field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Put your burnt offerings unto your sacrifices, and eat flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I spake not unto your fathers, nor commanded them in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, concerning burnt offerings or sacrifices:
speaker: Narrator

text: but this thing commanded I them, saying, Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and ye shall be my people: and walk ye in all the ways that I have commanded you, that it may be well unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they hearkened not, nor inclined their ear, but walked in the counsels and in the imagination of their evil heart, and went backward, and not forward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt unto this day I have even sent unto you all my servants the prophets, daily rising up early and sending them:
speaker: Narrator

text: yet they hearkened not unto me, nor inclined their ear, but hardened their neck: they did worse than their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt speak all these words unto them; but they will not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but they will not answer thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou shalt say unto them, This is a nation that obeyeth not the voice of the Lord their God, nor receiveth correction: truth is perished, and is cut off from their mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cut off thine hair, O Jerusalem, and cast it away, and take up a lamentation on high places; for the Lord hath rejected and forsaken the generation of his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the children of Judah have done evil in my sight, saith the Lord: they have set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to pollute it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they have built the high places of Tophet, which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire; which I commanded them not, neither came it into my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that it shall no more be called Tophet, nor the valley of the son of Hinnom, but the valley of slaughter: for they shall bury in Tophet, till there be no place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the carcases of this people shall be meat for the fowls of the heaven, and for the beasts of the earth; and none shall fray them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then will I cause to cease from the cities of Judah, and from the streets of Jerusalem, the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride: for the land shall be desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time, saith the Lord, they shall bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves:
speaker: Narrator

text: and they shall spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven, whom they have loved, and whom they have served, and after whom they have walked, and whom they have sought, and whom they have worshipped: they shall not be gathered, nor be buried; they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue of them that remain of this evil family, which remain in all the places whither I have driven them, saith the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover thou shalt say unto them,
Thus saith the Lord; Shall they fall, and not arise?
shall he turn away, and not return?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why then is this people of Jerusalem slidden back by a perpetual backsliding?
they hold fast deceit, they refuse to return.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hearkened and heard, but they spake not aright:
no man repented him of his wickedness,
saying, What have I done?
every one turned to his course,
as the horse rusheth into the battle.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
How do ye say, We are wise,
and the law of the Lord is with us?
Lo, certainly in vain made he it;
the pen of the scribes is in vain.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore will I give their wives unto others,
and their fields to them that shall inherit them:
for every one from the least even unto the greatest is given to covetousness,
from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they have healed the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly,
saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination?
nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush:
therefore shall they fall among them that fall:
in the time of their visitation they shall be cast down, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why do we sit still? assemble yourselves,
and let us enter into the defenced cities, and let us be silent there:
for the Lord our God hath put us to silence,
and given us water of gall to drink,
because we have sinned against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We looked for peace, but no good came;
and for a time of health, and behold trouble!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For, behold, I will send serpents, cockatrices, among you,
which will not be charmed,
and they shall bite you, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I would comfort myself against sorrow, my heart is faint in me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold the voice of the cry of the daughter of my people
because of them that dwell in a far country:
Is not the Lord in Zion? is not her king in her?
Why have they provoked me to anger
with their graven images, and with strange vanities?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The harvest is past, the summer is ended,
and we are not saved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the hurt of the daughter of my people am I hurt;
I am black; astonishment hath taken hold on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there?
why then is not the health of the daughter of my people recovered?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that my head were waters,
and mine eyes a fountain of tears,
that I might weep day and night
for the slain of the daughter of my people!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Take ye heed every one of his neighbour,
and trust ye not in any brother:
for every brother will utterly supplant,
and every neighbour will walk with slanders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they will deceive every one his neighbour,
and will not speak the truth:
they have taught their tongue to speak lies,
and weary themselves to commit iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thine habitation is in the midst of deceit;
through deceit they refuse to know me, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their tongue is as an arrow shot out;
it speaketh deceit:
one speaketh peaceably to his neighbour with his mouth,
but in heart he layeth his wait.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall I not visit them for these things? saith the Lord:
shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And I will make Jerusalem heaps, and a den of dragons;
and I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who is the wise man, that may understand this? and who is he to whom the mouth of the Lord hath spoken, that he may declare it, for what the land perisheth and is burned up like a wilderness, that none passeth through?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, neither walked therein;
speaker: Narrator

text: but have walked after the imagination of their own heart, and after Baalim, which their fathers taught them:
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will scatter them also among the heathen, whom neither they nor their fathers have known: and I will send a sword after them, till I have consumed them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
and let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us,
that our eyes may run down with tears,
and our eyelids gush out with waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion,
How are we spoiled!
we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land,
because our dwellings have cast us out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet hear the word of the Lord, O ye women,
and let your ear receive the word of his mouth,
and teach your daughters wailing,
and every one her neighbour lamentation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For death is come up into our windows,
and is entered into our palaces,
to cut off the children from without,
and the young men from the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Speak, Thus saith the Lord,
Even the carcases of men shall fall as dung upon the open field,
and as the handful after the harvestman,
and none shall gather them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord,
Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom,
neither let the mighty man glory in his might,
let not the rich man glory in his riches:
speaker: Narrator

text:
but let him that glorieth glory in this,
that he understandeth and knoweth me,
that I am the Lord which exercise lovingkindness,
judgment, and righteousness, in the earth:
for in these things I delight, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will punish all them which are circumcised with the uncircumcised;
speaker: Narrator

text: Egypt, and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that are in the utmost corners, that dwell in the wilderness: for all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye the word which the Lord speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text:
thus saith the Lord,
Learn not the way of the heathen,
and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven;
for the heathen are dismayed at them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They deck it with silver and with gold;
they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are upright as the palm tree, but speak not:
they must needs be borne, because they cannot go.
Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil,
neither also is it in them to do good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O Lord;
thou art great, and thy name is great in might.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who would not fear thee, O King of nations?
for to thee doth it appertain:
forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations,
and in all their kingdoms,
there is none like unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they are altogether brutish and foolish:
the stock is a doctrine of vanities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish,
and gold from Uphaz,
the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder:
blue and purple is their clothing:
they are all the work of cunning men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord is the true God,
he is the living God, and an everlasting king:
at his wrath the earth shall tremble,
and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus shall ye say unto them,
The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth,
even they shall perish from the earth,
and from under these heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He hath made the earth by his power,
he hath established the world by his wisdom,
and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens,
and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth;
he maketh lightnings with rain,
and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every man is brutish in his knowledge:
every founder is confounded by the graven image:
for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are vanity, and the work of errors:
in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The portion of Jacob is not like them:
for he is the former of all things;
and Israel is the rod of his inheritance:
The Lord of hosts is his name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gather up thy wares out of the land,
O inhabitant of the fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus saith the Lord,
Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once,
and will distress them, that they may find it so.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous:
but I said, Truly this is a grief, and I must bear it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken:
my children are gone forth of me, and they are not:
there is none to stretch forth my tent any more,
and to set up my curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the pastors are become brutish,
and have not sought the Lord:
therefore they shall not prosper,
and all their flocks shall be scattered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, the noise of the bruit is come,
and a great commotion out of the north country,
to make the cities of Judah desolate,
and a den of dragons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I know that the way of man is not in himself:
it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, correct me, but with judgment;
not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not,
and upon the families that call not on thy name:
for they have eaten up Jacob,
and devoured him, and consumed him,
and have made his habitation desolate.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and say thou unto them, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel; Cursed be the man that obeyeth not the words of this covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God:
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may perform the oath which I have sworn unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day. Then answered I, and said, So be it, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the imagination of their evil heart: therefore I will bring upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do; but they did them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, which refused to hear my words; and they went after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and though they shall cry unto me, I will not hearken unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall the cities of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem go, and cry unto the gods unto whom they offer incense: but they shall not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: For according to the number of thy cities were thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to that shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up a cry or prayer for them: for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me for their trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: What hath my beloved to do in mine house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord called thy name, A green olive tree, fair, and of goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord of hosts, that planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, for the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done against themselves to provoke me to anger in offering incense unto Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hath given me knowledge of it, and I know it: then thou shewedst me their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I was like a lamb or an ox that is brought to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.
speaker: Narrator

text: But, O Lord of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord of the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Prophesy not in the name of the Lord, that thou die not by our hand:
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine:
speaker: Narrator

text: and there shall be no remnant of them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteous art thou, O Lord, when I plead with thee:
yet let me talk with thee of thy judgments:
Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper?
wherefore are all they happy that deal very treacherously?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root:
they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit:
thou art near in their mouth, and far from their reins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But thou, O Lord, knowest me:
thou hast seen me, and tried mine heart toward thee:
pull them out like sheep for the slaughter,
and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long shall the land mourn,
and the herbs of every field wither,
for the wickedness of them that dwell therein?
the beasts are consumed, and the birds;
because they said, He shall not see our last end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee,
then how canst thou contend with horses?
and if in the land of peace, wherein thou trustedst, they wearied thee,
then how wilt thou do in the swelling of Jordan?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father,
even they have dealt treacherously with thee;
yea, they have called a multitude after thee:
believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have forsaken mine house, I have left mine heritage;
I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mine heritage is unto me as a lion in the forest;
it crieth out against me: therefore have I hated it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Many pastors have destroyed my vineyard,
they have trodden my portion under foot,
they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have made it desolate,
and being desolate it mourneth unto me;
the whole land is made desolate,
because no man layeth it to heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness:
for the sword of the Lord shall devour
from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land:
no flesh shall have peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns:
they have put themselves to pain, but shall not profit:
and they shall be ashamed of your revenues
because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord against all mine evil neighbours, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit; Behold, I will pluck them out of their land, and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them out I will return, and have compassion on them, and will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, The Lord liveth; as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built in the midst of my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they will not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord unto me, Go and get thee a linen girdle, and put it upon thy loins, and put it not in water.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I got a girdle according to the word of the Lord, and put it on my loins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came unto me the second time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take the girdle that thou hast got, which is upon thy loins, and arise, go to Euphrates, and hide it there in a hole of the rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I went, and hid it by Euphrates, as the Lord commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after many days, that the Lord said unto me, Arise, go to Euphrates, and take the girdle from thence, which I commanded thee to hide there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I went to Euphrates, and digged, and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it: and, behold, the girdle was marred, it was profitable for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, After this manner will I mar the pride of Judah, and the great pride of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: This evil people, which refuse to hear my words, which walk in the imagination of their heart, and walk after other gods, to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this girdle, which is good for nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as the girdle cleaveth to the loins of a man, so have I caused to cleave unto me the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah, saith the Lord; that they might be unto me for a people, and for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory: but they would not hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt speak unto them this word; Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Every bottle shall be filled with wine: and they shall say unto thee, Do we not certainly know that every bottle shall be filled with wine?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will fill all the inhabitants of this land, even the kings that sit upon David’s throne, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, with drunkenness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will dash them one against another, even the fathers and the sons together, saith the Lord: I will not pity, nor spare, nor have mercy, but destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear ye, and give ear; be not proud:
for the Lord hath spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give glory to the Lord your God, before he cause darkness,
and before your feet stumble upon the dark mountains,
and, while ye look for light, he turn it into the shadow of death,
and make it gross darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But if ye will not hear it,
my soul shall weep in secret places for your pride;
and mine eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears,
because the Lord’s flock is carried away captive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say unto the king and to the queen,
Humble yourselves, sit down:
for your principalities shall come down,
even the crown of your glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cities of the south shall be shut up, and none shall open them:
Judah shall be carried away captive all of it,
it shall be wholly carried away captive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your eyes, and behold them that come from the north:
where is the flock that was given thee, thy beautiful flock?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And if thou say in thine heart, Wherefore come these things upon me?
For the greatness of thine iniquity are thy skirts discovered,
and thy heels made bare.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots?
then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore will I scatter them as the stubble
that passeth away by the wind of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is thy lot, the portion of thy measures from me, saith the Lord;
because thou hast forgotten me, and trusted in falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore will I discover thy skirts upon thy face,
that thy shame may appear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen thine adulteries, and thy neighings,
the lewdness of thy whoredom,
and thine abominations on the hills in the fields.
Woe unto thee, O Jerusalem!
wilt thou not be made clean?
when shall it once be?
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the dearth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Because the ground is chapt,
for there was no rain in the earth,
the plowmen were ashamed,
they covered their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yea, the hind also calved in the field,
and forsook it, because there was no grass.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O Lord, though our iniquities testify against us,
do thou it for thy name’s sake:
for our backslidings are many;
we have sinned against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O the hope of Israel, the saviour thereof in time of trouble,
why shouldest thou be as a stranger in the land,
and as a wayfaring man that turneth aside to tarry for a night?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why shouldest thou be as a man astonied,
as a mighty man that cannot save?
yet thou, O Lord, art in the midst of us,
and we are called by thy name;
leave us not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord unto this people, Thus have they loved to wander, they have not refrained their feet, therefore the Lord doth not accept them; he will now remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord unto me, Pray not for this people for their good.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and an oblation, I will not accept them: but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said I, Ah, Lord God! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name: I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither spake unto them: they prophesy unto you a false vision and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land; By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they shall have none to bury them, them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness upon them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
If I go forth into the field,
then behold the slain with the sword!
and if I enter into the city,
then behold them that are sick with famine!
yea, both the prophet and the priest go about into a land that they know not.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hast thou utterly rejected Judah?
hath thy soul lothed Zion?
why hast thou smitten us, and there is no healing for us?
we looked for peace, and there is no good;
and for the time of healing, and behold trouble!
speaker: Narrator

text:
We acknowledge, O Lord, our wickedness,
and the iniquity of our fathers:
for we have sinned against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not abhor us, for thy name’s sake,
do not disgrace the throne of thy glory:
remember, break not thy covenant with us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are there any among the vanities of the Gentiles that can cause rain?
or can the heavens give showers?
art not thou he, O Lord our God?
therefore we will wait upon thee:
for thou hast made all these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind could not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the Lord; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the Lord: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the Lord, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they return not from their ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them doth curse me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, thou knowest:
remember me, and visit me,
and revenge me of my persecutors;
take me not away in thy longsuffering:
know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable,
which refuseth to be healed?
wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar,
and as waters that fail?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus saith the Lord,
If thou return, then will I bring thee again,
and thou shalt stand before me:
and if thou take forth the precious from the vile,
thou shalt be as my mouth:
let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall:
and they shall fight against thee,
but they shall not prevail against thee:
for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked,
and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word of the Lord came also unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that are born in this place, and concerning their mothers that bare them, and concerning their fathers that begat them in this land;
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall die of grievous deaths; they shall not be lamented; neither shall they be buried; but they shall be as dung upon the face of the earth: and they shall be consumed by the sword, and by famine; and their carcases shall be meat for the fowls of heaven, and for the beasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord, Enter not into the house of mourning, neither go to lament nor bemoan them: for I have taken away my peace from this people, saith the Lord, even lovingkindness and mercies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both the great and the small shall die in this land: they shall not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them:
speaker: Narrator

text: neither shall men tear themselves for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt not also go into the house of feasting, to sit with them to eat and to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place in your eyes, and in your days, the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt shew this people all these words, and they shall say unto thee, Wherefore hath the Lord pronounced all this great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or what is our sin that we have committed against the Lord our God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou say unto them, Because your fathers have forsaken me, saith the Lord, and have walked after other gods, and have served them, and have worshipped them, and have forsaken me, and have not kept my law;
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye have done worse than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk every one after the imagination of his evil heart, that they may not hearken unto me:
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore will I cast you out of this land into a land that ye know not, neither ye nor your fathers; and there shall ye serve other gods day and night; where I will not shew you favour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that it shall no more be said, The Lord liveth, that brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: but, The Lord liveth, that brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the lands whither he had driven them: and I will bring them again into their land that I gave unto their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will send for many fishers, saith the Lord, and they shall fish them; and after will I send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain, and from every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: For mine eyes are upon all their ways: they are not hid from my face, neither is their iniquity hid from mine eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double; because they have defiled my land, they have filled mine inheritance with the carcases of their detestable and abominable things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, my strength, and my fortress,
and my refuge in the day of affliction,
the Gentiles shall come unto thee from the ends of the earth, and shall say,
Surely our fathers have inherited lies, vanity,
and things wherein there is no profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall a man make gods unto himself, and they are no gods?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the point of a diamond: it is graven upon the table of their heart, and upon the horns of your altars;
speaker: Narrator

text: whilst their children remember their altars and their groves by the green trees upon the high hills.
speaker: Narrator

text: O my mountain in the field, I will give thy substance and all thy treasures to the spoil, and thy high places for sin, throughout all thy borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou, even thyself, shalt discontinue from thine heritage that I gave thee; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies in the land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindled a fire in mine anger, which shall burn for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord;
Cursed be the man that trusteth in man,
and maketh flesh his arm,
and whose heart departeth from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he shall be like the heath in the desert,
and shall not see when good cometh;
but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness,
in a salt land and not inhabited.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the man that trusteth in the Lord,
and whose hope the Lord is.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he shall be as a tree planted by the waters,
and that spreadeth out her roots by the river,
and shall not see when heat cometh,
but her leaf shall be green;
and shall not be careful in the year of drought,
neither shall cease from yielding fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heart is deceitful above all things,
and desperately wicked: who can know it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I the Lord search the heart, I try the reins,
even to give every man according to his ways,
and according to the fruit of his doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the partridge sitteth on eggs, and hatcheth them not;
so he that getteth riches, and not by right,
shall leave them in the midst of his days,
and at his end shall be a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A glorious high throne from the beginning
is the place of our sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, the hope of Israel,
all that forsake thee shall be ashamed,
and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth,
because they have forsaken the Lord,
the fountain of living waters.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Behold, they say unto me,
Where is the word of the Lord? let it come now.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I have not hastened from being a pastor to follow thee:
neither have I desired the woeful day; thou knowest:
that which came out of my lips was right before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not a terror unto me:
thou art my hope in the day of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be confounded that persecute me,
but let not me be confounded:
let them be dismayed,
but let not me be dismayed:
bring upon them the day of evil,
and destroy them with double destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus said the Lord unto me; Go and stand in the gate of the children of the people, whereby the kings of Judah come in, and by the which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: and say unto them, Hear ye the word of the Lord, ye kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:
speaker: Narrator

text: thus saith the Lord; Take heed to yourselves, and bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the sabbath day, neither do ye any work, but hallow ye the sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they obeyed not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, nor receive instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith the Lord, to bring in no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath day, but hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;
speaker: Narrator

text: then shall there enter into the gates of this city kings and princes sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: and this city shall remain for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall come from the cities of Judah, and from the places about Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the plain, and from the mountains, and from the south, bringing burnt offerings, and sacrifices, and meat offerings, and incense, and bringing sacrifices of praise, unto the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day, and not to bear a burden, even entering in at the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath day; then will I kindle a fire in the gates thereof, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it shall not be quenched.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Arise, and go down to the potter’s house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I went down to the potter’s house, and, behold, he wrought a work on the wheels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the vessel that he made of clay was marred in the hand of the potter: so he made it again another vessel, as seemed good to the potter to make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: O house of Israel, cannot I do with you as this potter? saith the Lord. Behold, as the clay is in the potter’s hand, so are ye in mine hand, O house of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to pluck up, and to pull down, and to destroy it;
speaker: Narrator

text: if that nation, against whom I have pronounced, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom, to build and to plant it;
speaker: Narrator

text: if it do evil in my sight, that it obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good, wherewith I said I would benefit them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore go to, speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I frame evil against you, and devise a device against you: return ye now every one from his evil way, and make your ways and your doings good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, There is no hope: but we will walk after our own devices, and we will every one do the imagination of his evil heart.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Will a man leave the snow of Lebanon which cometh from the rock of the field?
or shall the cold flowing waters that come from another place be forsaken?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because my people hath forgotten me,
they have burned incense to vanity,
and they have caused them to stumble
in their ways from the ancient paths,
to walk in paths, in a way not cast up;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: Then said they, Come, and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, and let us smite him with the tongue, and let us not give heed to any of his words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give heed to me, O Lord,
and hearken to the voice of them that contend with me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall evil be recompensed for good?
for they have digged a pit for my soul.
Remember that I stood before thee to speak good for them,
and to turn away thy wrath from them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let a cry be heard from their houses,
when thou shalt bring a troop suddenly upon them:
for they have digged a pit to take me,
and hid snares for my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet, Lord, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay me:
forgive not their iniquity,
neither blot out their sin from thy sight,
but let them be overthrown before thee;
deal thus with them in the time of thine anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, Go and get a potter’s earthen bottle, and take of the ancients of the people, and of the ancients of the priests;
speaker: Narrator

text: and go forth unto the valley of the son of Hinnom, which is by the entry of the east gate, and proclaim there the words that I shall tell thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, Hear ye the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah, and inhabitants of Jerusalem; Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, the which whosoever heareth, his ears shall tingle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they have forsaken me, and have estranged this place, and have burned incense in it unto other gods, whom neither they nor their fathers have known, nor the kings of Judah, and have filled this place with the blood of innocents;
speaker: Narrator

text: they have built also the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire for burnt offerings unto Baal, which I commanded not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that this place shall no more be called Tophet, nor The valley of the son of Hinnom, but The valley of slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hands of them that seek their lives: and their carcases will I give to be meat for the fowls of the heaven, and for the beasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will make this city desolate, and an hissing; every one that passeth thereby shall be astonished and hiss because of all the plagues thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they shall eat every one the flesh of his friend in the siege and straitness, wherewith their enemies, and they that seek their lives, shall straiten them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou break the bottle in the sight of the men that go with thee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Even so will I break this people and this city, as one breaketh a potter’s vessel, that cannot be made whole again: and they shall bury them in Tophet, till there be no place to bury.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus will I do unto this place, saith the Lord, and to the inhabitants thereof, and even make this city as Tophet:
speaker: Narrator

text: and the houses of Jerusalem, and the houses of the kings of Judah, shall be defiled as the place of Tophet, because of all the houses upon whose roofs they have burned incense unto all the host of heaven, and have poured out drink offerings unto other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Jeremiah from Tophet, whither the Lord had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of the Lord’s house; and said to all the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will bring upon this city and upon all her towns all the evil that I have pronounced against it, because they have hardened their necks, that they might not hear my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest, who was also chief governor in the house of the Lord, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pashur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him, The Lord hath not called thy name Pashur, but Magor-missabib.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends: and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it: and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive into Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I will deliver all the strength of this city, and all the labours thereof, and all the precious things thereof, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies, which shall spoil them, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou, Pashur, and all that dwell in thine house shall go into captivity: and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and shalt be buried there, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied lies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, thou hast deceived me,
and I was deceived:
thou art stronger than I,
and hast prevailed:
I am in derision daily,
every one mocketh me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For since I spake, I cried out,
I cried violence and spoil;
because the word of the Lord
was made a reproach unto me,
and a derision, daily.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said, I will not make mention of him,
nor speak any more in his name.
But his word was in mine heart
as a burning fire shut up in my bones,
and I was weary with forbearing,
and I could not stay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I heard the defaming of many,
fear on every side.
Report, say they, and we will report it.
All my familiars watched for my halting, saying,
Peradventure he will be enticed,
and we shall prevail against him,
and we shall take our revenge on him.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But, O Lord of hosts, that triest the righteous,
and seest the reins and the heart,
let me see thy vengeance on them:
for unto thee have I opened my cause.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing unto the Lord, praise ye the Lord:
