for he hath delivered the soul of the poor
from the hand of evildoers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cursed be the day wherein I was born:
let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And let that man be as the cities
which the Lord overthrew, and repented not:
and let him hear the cry in the morning,
and the shouting at noontide;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Wherefore came I forth out of the womb
to see labour and sorrow,
that my days should be consumed with shame?
speaker: Narrator

text: The word which came unto Jeremiah from the Lord, when king Zedekiah sent unto him Pashur the son of Melchiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Enquire, I pray thee, of the Lord for us; for Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon maketh war against us; if so be that the Lord will deal with us according to all his wondrous works, that he may go up from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Jeremiah unto them, Thus shall ye say to Zedekiah:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord God of Israel; Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands, wherewith ye fight against the king of Babylon, and against the Chaldeans, which besiege you without the walls, and I will assemble them into the midst of this city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, and in fury, and in great wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will smite the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast: they shall die of a great pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward, saith the Lord, I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, and his servants, and the people, and such as are left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those that seek their life: and he shall smite them with the edge of the sword; he shall not spare them, neither have pity, nor have mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto this people thou shalt say, Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I set before you the way of life, and the way of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that abideth in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence: but he that goeth out, and falleth to the Chaldeans that besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be unto him for a prey.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have set my face against this city for evil, and not for good, saith the Lord: it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And touching the house of the king of Judah, say, Hear ye the word of the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text:
O house of David, thus saith the Lord;
Execute judgment in the morning,
and deliver him that is spoiled
out of the hand of the oppressor,
lest my fury go out like fire,
and burn that none can quench it,
because of the evil of your doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I am against thee,
O inhabitant of the valley,
and rock of the plain, saith the Lord;
which say, Who shall come down against us?
or who shall enter into our habitations?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will punish you
according to the fruit of your doings, saith the Lord:
and I will kindle a fire in the forest thereof,
and it shall devour all things round about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord; Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and speak there this word,
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, Hear the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, that sittest upon the throne of David, thou, and thy servants, and thy people that enter in by these gates:
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord; Execute ye judgment and righteousness, and deliver the spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor: and do no wrong, do no violence to the stranger, the fatherless, nor the widow, neither shed innocent blood in this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if ye do this thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the gates of this house kings sitting upon the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, he, and his servants, and his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye will not hear these words, I swear by myself, saith the Lord, that this house shall become a desolation.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord unto the king’s house of Judah; Thou art Gilead unto me, and the head of Lebanon: yet surely I will make thee a wilderness, and cities which are not inhabited.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will prepare destroyers against thee, every one with his weapons: and they shall cut down thy choice cedars, and cast them into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many nations shall pass by this city, and they shall say every man to his neighbour, Wherefore hath the Lord done thus unto this great city?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall answer, Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God, and worshipped other gods, and served them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Weep ye not for the dead, neither bemoan him: but weep sore for him that goeth away: for he shall return no more, nor see his native country.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord touching Shallum the son of Josiah king of Judah, which reigned instead of Josiah his father, which went forth out of this place; He shall not return thither any more:
speaker: Narrator

text: but he shall die in the place whither they have led him captive, and shall see this land no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe unto him that buildeth his house by unrighteousness, and his chambers by wrong; that useth his neighbour’s service without wages, and giveth him not for his work;
speaker: Narrator

text: that saith, I will build me a wide house and large chambers, and cutteth him out windows; and it is cieled with cedar, and painted with vermilion.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shalt thou reign, because thou closest thyself in cedar? did not thy father eat and drink, and do judgment and justice, and then it was well with him?
speaker: Narrator

text: He judged the cause of the poor and needy; then it was well with him: was not this to know me? saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thine eyes and thine heart are not but for thy covetousness, and for to shed innocent blood, and for oppression, and for violence, to do it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus saith the Lord concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah;
They shall not lament for him,
saying, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister!
they shall not lament for him,
saying, Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall be buried with the burial of an ass,
drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go up to Lebanon, and cry;
and lift up thy voice in Bashan,
and cry from the passages:
for all thy lovers are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I spake unto thee in thy prosperity;
but thou saidst, I will not hear.
This hath been thy manner from thy youth,
that thou obeyedst not my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wind shall eat up all thy pastors,
and thy lovers shall go into captivity:
surely then shalt thou be ashamed
and confounded for all thy wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O inhabitant of Lebanon,
that makest thy nest in the cedars,
how gracious shalt thou be
when pangs come upon thee,
the pain as of a woman in travail!
speaker: Narrator

text: As I live, saith the Lord, though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were the signet upon my right hand, yet would I pluck thee thence;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will give thee into the hand of them that seek thy life, and into the hand of them whose face thou fearest, even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will cast thee out, and thy mother that bare thee, into another country, where ye were not born; and there shall ye die.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the land whereunto they desire to return, thither shall they not return.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is this man Coniah a despised broken idol? is he a vessel wherein is no pleasure? wherefore are they cast out, he and his seed, and are cast into a land which they know not?
speaker: Narrator

text: O earth, earth, earth, hear the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, Write ye this man childless, a man that shall not prosper in his days: for no man of his seed shall prosper, sitting upon the throne of David, and ruling any more in Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe be unto the pastors that destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord God of Israel against the pastors that feed my people; Ye have scattered my flock, and driven them away, and have not visited them: behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will set up shepherds over them which shall feed them: and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall they be lacking, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely: and this is his name whereby he shall be called, The Lord our righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that they shall no more say, The Lord liveth, which brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: but, The Lord liveth, which brought up and which led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all countries whither I had driven them; and they shall dwell in their own land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mine heart within me is broken
because of the prophets;
all my bones shake;
I am like a drunken man,
and like a man whom wine hath overcome,
because of the Lord,
and because of the words of his holiness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For both prophet and priest are profane;
yea, in my house have I found their wickedness, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wherefore their way shall be unto them
as slippery ways in the darkness:
they shall be driven on, and fall therein:
for I will bring evil upon them,
even the year of their visitation, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria;
they prophesied in Baal, and caused my people Israel to err.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen also in the prophets of Jerusalem an horrible thing:
they commit adultery, and walk in lies:
they strengthen also the hands of evildoers,
that none doth return from his wickedness:
they are all of them unto me as Sodom,
and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts concerning the prophets; Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink the water of gall: for from the prophets of Jerusalem is profaneness gone forth into all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they make you vain: they speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: They say still unto them that despise me, The Lord hath said, Ye shall have peace; and they say unto every one that walketh after the imagination of his own heart, No evil shall come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For who hath stood in the counsel of the Lord,
and hath perceived and heard his word?
who hath marked his word, and heard it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, a whirlwind of the Lord is gone forth in fury,
even a grievous whirlwind:
it shall fall grievously upon the head of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The anger of the Lord shall not return,
until he have executed,
and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart:
in the latter days ye shall consider it perfectly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not sent these prophets, yet they ran:
I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But if they had stood in my counsel,
and had caused my people to hear my words,
then they should have turned them from their evil way,
and from the evil of their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Am I a God at hand, saith the Lord,
and not a God afar off?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Can any hide himself in secret places
that I shall not see him? saith the Lord.
Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have heard what the prophets said,
that prophesy lies in my name,
saying, I have dreamed, I have dreamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long shall this be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies? yea, they are prophets of the deceit of their own heart;
speaker: Narrator

text: which think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbour, as their fathers have forgotten my name for Baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the chaff to the wheat? saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not my word like as a fire? saith the Lord; and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Lord, that steal my words every one from his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I am against the prophets, saith the Lord, that use their tongues, and say, He saith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I am against them that prophesy false dreams, saith the Lord, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their lightness; yet I sent them not, nor commanded them: therefore they shall not profit this people at all, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What is the burden of the Lord? thou shalt then say unto them, What burden? I will even forsake you, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for the prophet, and the priest, and the people, that shall say, The burden of the Lord, I will even punish that man and his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shall ye say every one to his neighbour, and every one to his brother, What hath the Lord answered? and, What hath the Lord spoken?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the burden of the Lord shall ye mention no more: for every man’s word shall be his burden; for ye have perverted the words of the living God, of the Lord of hosts our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shalt thou say to the prophet, What hath the Lord answered thee? and, What hath the Lord spoken?
speaker: Narrator

text: But since ye say, The burden of the Lord; therefore thus saith the Lord; Because ye say this word, The burden of the Lord, and I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore, behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you, and I will forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers, and cast you out of my presence:
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord shewed me, and, behold, two baskets of figs were set before the temple of the Lord, after that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, with the carpenters and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: One basket had very good figs, even like the figs that are first ripe: and the other basket had very naughty figs, which could not be eaten, they were so bad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the Lord unto me, What seest thou, Jeremiah? And I said, Figs; the good figs, very good; and the evil, very evil, that cannot be eaten, they are so evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the word of the Lord came unto me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel; Like these good figs, so will I acknowledge them that are carried away captive of Judah, whom I have sent out of this place into the land of the Chaldeans for their good.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will set mine eyes upon them for good, and I will bring them again to this land: and I will build them, and not pull them down; and I will plant them, and not pluck them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will give them an heart to know me, that I am the Lord: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God: for they shall return unto me with their whole heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as the evil figs, which cannot be eaten, they are so evil; surely thus saith the Lord, So will I give Zedekiah the king of Judah, and his princes, and the residue of Jerusalem, that remain in this land, and them that dwell in the land of Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will deliver them to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth for their hurt, to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places whither I shall drive them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, among them, till they be consumed from off the land that I gave unto them and to their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, that was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon;
speaker: Narrator

text: the which Jeremiah the prophet spake unto all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, even unto this day, that is the three and twentieth year, the word of the Lord hath come unto me, and I have spoken unto you, rising early and speaking; but ye have not hearkened.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hath sent unto you all his servants the prophets, rising early and sending them; but ye have not hearkened, nor inclined your ear to hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, Turn ye again now every one from his evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that the Lord hath given unto you and to your fathers for ever and ever:
speaker: Narrator

text: and go not after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, and provoke me not to anger with the works of your hands; and I will do you no hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet ye have not hearkened unto me, saith the Lord; that ye might provoke me to anger with the works of your hands to your own hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts; Because ye have not heard my words,
speaker: Narrator

text: behold, I will send and take all the families of the north, saith the Lord, and Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will bring them against this land, and against the inhabitants thereof, and against all these nations round about, and will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and an hissing, and perpetual desolations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the candle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this whole land shall be a desolation, and an astonishment; and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the king of Babylon, and that nation, saith the Lord, for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans, and will make it perpetual desolations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will bring upon that land all my words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah hath prophesied against all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of them also: and I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the works of their own hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord God of Israel unto me; Take the wine cup of this fury at my hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send thee, to drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall drink, and be moved, and be mad, because of the sword that I will send among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then took I the cup at the Lord’s hand, and made all the nations to drink, unto whom the Lord had sent me:
speaker: Narrator

text: to wit, Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, and the kings thereof, and the princes thereof, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, an hissing, and a curse; as it is this day;
speaker: Narrator

text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, and his servants, and his princes, and all his people;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the mingled people, and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the land of the Philistines, and Ashkelon, and Azzah, and Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod,
speaker: Narrator

text: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the kings of Tyrus, and all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the isles which are beyond the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dedan, and Tema, and Buz, and all that are in the utmost corners,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mingled people that dwell in the desert,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another, and all the kingdoms of the world, which are upon the face of the earth: and the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Drink ye, and be drunken, and spue, and fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at thine hand to drink, then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith the Lord of hosts; Ye shall certainly drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, I begin to bring evil on the city which is called by my name, and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished: for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith the Lord of hosts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, Behold, evil shall go forth from nation to nation, and a great whirlwind shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the slain of the Lord shall be at that day from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth: they shall not be lamented, neither gathered, nor buried; they shall be dung upon the ground.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And the shepherds shall have no way to flee,
nor the principal of the flock to escape.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A voice of the cry of the shepherds,
and an howling of the principal of the flock, shall be heard:
for the Lord hath spoiled their pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the peaceable habitations are cut down
because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He hath forsaken his covert, as the lion:
for their land is desolate
because of the fierceness of the oppressor,
and because of his fierce anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word from the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord; Stand in the court of the Lord’s house, and speak unto all the cities of Judah, which come to worship in the Lord’s house, all the words that I command thee to speak unto them; diminish not a word:
speaker: Narrator

text: if so be they will hearken, and turn every man from his evil way, that I may repent me of the evil, which I purpose to do unto them because of the evil of their doings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the Lord; If ye will not hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set before you,
speaker: Narrator

text: to hearken to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I sent unto you, both rising up early, and sending them, but ye have not hearkened;
speaker: Narrator

text: then will I make this house like Shiloh, and will make this city a curse to all the nations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it came to pass, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking all that the Lord had commanded him to speak unto all the people, that the priests and the prophets and all the people took him, saying, Thou shalt surely die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why hast thou prophesied in the name of the Lord, saying, This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate without an inhabitant? And all the people were gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the princes of Judah heard these things, then they came up from the king’s house unto the house of the Lord, and sat down in the entry of the new gate of the Lord’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spake the priests and the prophets unto the princes and to all the people, saying, This man is worthy to die; for he hath prophesied against this city, as ye have heard with your ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spake Jeremiah unto all the princes and to all the people, saying, The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that ye have heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore now amend your ways and your doings, and obey the voice of the Lord your God; and the Lord will repent him of the evil that he hath pronounced against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good and meet unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But know ye for certain, that if ye put me to death, ye shall surely bring innocent blood upon yourselves, and upon this city, and upon the inhabitants thereof: for of a truth the Lord hath sent me unto you to speak all these words in your ears.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the princes and all the people unto the priests and to the prophets; This man is not worthy to die: for he hath spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then rose up certain of the elders of the land, and spake to all the assembly of the people, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Micah the Morasthite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spake to all the people of Judah, saying, Thus saith the Lord of hosts;
Zion shall be plowed like a field,
and Jerusalem shall become heaps,
and the mountain of the house
as the high places of a forest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him at all to death? did he not fear the Lord, and besought the Lord, and the Lord repented him of the evil which he had pronounced against them? Thus might we procure great evil against our souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was also a man that prophesied in the name of the Lord, Urijah the son of Shemaiah of Kirjath-jearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land according to all the words of Jeremiah:
speaker: Narrator

text: and when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men, and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death: but when Urijah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jehoiakim the king sent men into Egypt, namely, Elnathan the son of Achbor, and certain men with him into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they fetched forth Urijah out of Egypt, and brought him unto Jehoiakim the king; who slew him with the sword, and cast his dead body into the graves of the common people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah came this word unto Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord to me; Make thee bonds and yokes, and put them upon thy neck,
speaker: Narrator

text: and send them to the king of Edom, and to the king of Moab, and to the king of the Ammonites, and to the king of Tyrus, and to the king of Zidon, by the hand of the messengers which come to Jerusalem unto Zedekiah king of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and command them to say unto their masters, Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say unto your masters;
speaker: Narrator

text: I have made the earth, the man and the beast that are upon the ground, by my great power and by my outstretched arm, and have given it unto whom it seemed meet unto me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now have I given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant; and the beasts of the field have I given him also to serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all nations shall serve him, and his son, and his son’s son, until the very time of his land come: and then many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, that the nation and kingdom which will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and that will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, that nation will I punish, saith the Lord, with the sword, and with the famine, and with the pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hearken not ye to your prophets, nor to your diviners, nor to your dreamers, nor to your enchanters, nor to your sorcerers, which speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon:
speaker: Narrator

text: for they prophesy a lie unto you, to remove you far from your land; and that I should drive you out, and ye should perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the nations that bring their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him, those will I let remain still in their own land, saith the Lord; and they shall till it, and dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: I spake also to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words, saying, Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people, and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why will ye die, thou and thy people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as the Lord hath spoken against the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore hearken not unto the words of the prophets that speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have not sent them, saith the Lord, yet they prophesy a lie in my name; that I might drive you out, and that ye might perish, ye, and the prophets that prophesy unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also I spake to the priests and to all this people, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Hearken not to the words of your prophets that prophesy unto you, saying, Behold, the vessels of the Lord’s house shall now shortly be brought again from Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken not unto them; serve the king of Babylon, and live: wherefore should this city be laid waste?
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they be prophets, and if the word of the Lord be with them, let them now make intercession to the Lord of hosts, that the vessels which are left in the house of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem, go not to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord of hosts concerning the pillars, and concerning the sea, and concerning the bases, and concerning the residue of the vessels that remain in this city,
speaker: Narrator

text: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took not, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: yea, thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that remain in the house of the Lord, and in the house of the king of Judah and of Jerusalem;
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall be carried to Babylon, and there shall they be until the day that I visit them, saith the Lord; then will I bring them up, and restore them to this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, and in the fifth month, that Hananiah the son of Azur the prophet, which was of Gibeon, spake unto me in the house of the Lord, in the presence of the priests and of all the people, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus speaketh the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of the Lord’s house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried them to Babylon:
speaker: Narrator

text: and I will bring again to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, with all the captives of Judah, that went into Babylon, saith the Lord: for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the prophet Jeremiah said unto the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests, and in the presence of all the people that stood in the house of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: the Lord do so: the Lord perform thy words which thou hast prophesied, to bring again the vessels of the Lord’s house, and all that is carried away captive, from Babylon into this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless hear thou now this word that I speak in thine ears, and in the ears of all the people;
speaker: Narrator

text: the prophets that have been before me and before thee of old prophesied both against many countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of pestilence.
speaker: Narrator

text: The prophet which prophesieth of peace, when the word of the prophet shall come to pass, then shall the prophet be known, that the Lord hath truly sent him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from off the prophet Jeremiah’s neck, and brake it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hananiah spake in the presence of all the people, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Even so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all nations within the space of two full years. And the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came unto Jeremiah the prophet, after that Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Go and tell Hananiah, saying, Thus saith the Lord; Thou hast broken the yokes of wood; but thou shalt make for them yokes of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; I have put a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they shall serve him: and I have given him the beasts of the field also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said the prophet Jeremiah unto Hananiah the prophet, Hear now, Hananiah; The Lord hath not sent thee; but thou makest this people to trust in a lie.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will cast thee from off the face of the earth: this year thou shalt die, because thou hast taught rebellion against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Hananiah the prophet died the same year in the seventh month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem unto the residue of the elders which were carried away captives, and to the priests, and to the prophets, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon;
speaker: Narrator

text: (after that Jeconiah the king, and the queen, and the eunuchs, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, and the carpenters, and the smiths, were departed from Jerusalem;)
speaker: Narrator

text: by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, (whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent unto Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon) saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, unto all that are carried away captives, whom I have caused to be carried away from Jerusalem unto Babylon;
speaker: Narrator

text: build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them;
speaker: Narrator

text: take ye wives, and beget sons and daughters; and take wives for your sons, and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters; that ye may be increased there, and not diminished.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seek the peace of the city whither I have caused you to be carried away captives, and pray unto the Lord for it: for in the peace thereof shall ye have peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Let not your prophets and your diviners, that be in the midst of you, deceive you, neither hearken to your dreams which ye cause to be dreamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they prophesy falsely unto you in my name: I have not sent them, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord, That after seventy years be accomplished at Babylon I will visit you, and perform my good word toward you, in causing you to return to this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shall ye call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me, and I will hearken unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye shall seek me, and find me, when ye shall search for me with all your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will be found of you, saith the Lord: and I will turn away your captivity, and I will gather you from all the nations, and from all the places whither I have driven you, saith the Lord; and I will bring you again into the place whence I caused you to be carried away captive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because ye have said, The Lord hath raised us up prophets in Babylon;
speaker: Narrator

text: know that thus saith the Lord of the king that sitteth upon the throne of David, and of all the people that dwelleth in this city, and of your brethren that are not gone forth with you into captivity;
speaker: Narrator

text: thus saith the Lord of hosts; Behold, I will send upon them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like vile figs, that cannot be eaten, they are so evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will persecute them with the sword, with the famine, and with the pestilence, and will deliver them to be removed to all the kingdoms of the earth, to be a curse, and an astonishment, and an hissing, and a reproach, among all the nations whither I have driven them:
speaker: Narrator

text: because they have not hearkened to my words, saith the Lord, which I sent unto them by my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; but ye would not hear, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear ye therefore the word of the Lord, all ye of the captivity, whom I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon:
speaker: Narrator

text: thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, of Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and of Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, which prophesy a lie unto you in my name; Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon; and he shall slay them before your eyes;
speaker: Narrator

text: and of them shall be taken up a curse by all the captivity of Judah which are in Babylon, saying, The Lord make thee like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;
speaker: Narrator

text: because they have committed villany in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbours’ wives, and have spoken lying words in my name, which I have not commanded them; even I know, and am a witness, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus shalt thou also speak to Shemaiah the Nehelamite, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus speaketh the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saying, Because thou hast sent letters in thy name unto all the people that are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord hath made thee priest in the stead of Jehoiada the priest, that ye should be officers in the house of the Lord, for every man that is mad, and maketh himself a prophet, that thou shouldest put him in prison, and in the stocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore why hast thou not reproved Jeremiah of Anathoth, which maketh himself a prophet to you?
speaker: Narrator

text: For therefore he sent unto us in Babylon, saying, This captivity is long: build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the ears of Jeremiah the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came the word of the Lord unto Jeremiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus saith the Lord concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite; Because that Shemaiah hath prophesied unto you, and I sent him not, and he caused you to trust in a lie:
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite, and his seed: he shall not have a man to dwell among this people; neither shall he behold the good that I will do for my people, saith the Lord; because he hath taught rebellion against the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus speaketh the Lord God of Israel, saying, Write thee all the words that I have spoken unto thee in a book.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, lo, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will bring again the captivity of my people Israel and Judah, saith the Lord: and I will cause them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the words that the Lord spake concerning Israel and concerning Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord; We have heard a voice of trembling, of fear, and not of peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child? wherefore do I see every man with his hands on his loins, as a woman in travail, and all faces are turned into paleness?
speaker: Narrator

text: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob’s trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off thy neck, and will burst thy bonds, and strangers shall no more serve themselves of him:
speaker: Narrator

text: but they shall serve the Lord their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up unto them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For I am with thee, saith the Lord, to save thee:
though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered thee,
yet will I not make a full end of thee:
but I will correct thee in measure,
and will not leave thee altogether unpunished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus saith the Lord,
Thy bruise is incurable,
and thy wound is grievous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is none to plead thy cause,
that thou mayest be bound up:
thou hast no healing medicines.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why criest thou for thine affliction?
thy sorrow is incurable for the multitude of thine iniquity:
because thy sins were increased,
I have done these things unto thee.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For I will restore health unto thee,
and I will heal thee of thy wounds, saith the Lord;
because they called thee an Outcast, saying,
This is Zion, whom no man seeketh after.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And out of them shall proceed thanksgiving
and the voice of them that make merry:
and I will multiply them,
and they shall not be few;
I will also glorify them,
and they shall not be small.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their children also shall be as aforetime,
and their congregation shall be established before me,
and I will punish all that oppress them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And their nobles shall be of themselves,
and their governor shall proceed from the midst of them;
and I will cause him to draw near,
and he shall approach unto me:
for who is this that engaged his heart
to approach unto me? saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And ye shall be my people,
and I will be your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, the whirlwind of the Lord goeth forth with fury,
a continuing whirlwind:
it shall fall with pain upon the head of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fierce anger of the Lord shall not return, until he have done it,
and until he have performed the intents of his heart:
in the latter days ye shall consider it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At the same time, saith the Lord,
will I be the God of all the families of Israel,
and they shall be my people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord,
The people which were left of the sword
found grace in the wilderness;
even Israel, when I went to cause him to rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord hath appeared of old unto me, saying,
Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love:
therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Again I will build thee, and thou shalt be built,
O virgin of Israel:
thou shalt again be adorned with thy tabrets,
and shalt go forth in the dances of them that make merry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thou shalt yet plant vines upon the mountains of Samaria:
the planters shall plant, and shall eat them as common things.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the mount Ephraim shall cry,
Arise ye, and let us go up to Zion unto the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus saith the Lord;
Sing with gladness for Jacob,
and shout among the chief of the nations:
publish ye, praise ye, and say,
O Lord, save thy people, the remnant of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I will bring them from the north country,
and gather them from the coasts of the earth,
and with them the blind and the lame,
the woman with child and her that travaileth with child together:
a great company shall return thither.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall come with weeping,
and with supplications will I lead them:
I will cause them to walk by the rivers of waters in a straight way,
wherein they shall not stumble:
for I am a father to Israel,
and Ephraim is my firstborn.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear the word of the Lord, O ye nations,
and declare it in the isles afar off, and say,
He that scattered Israel will gather him, and keep him,
as a shepherd doth his flock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord hath redeemed Jacob,
and ransomed him from the hand of him that was stronger than he.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance,
both young men and old together:
for I will turn their mourning into joy,
and will comfort them,
and make them rejoice from their sorrow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will satiate the soul of the priests with fatness,
and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Thus saith the Lord; Refrain thy voice from weeping,
and thine eyes from tears:
for thy work shall be rewarded, saith the Lord;
and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And there is hope in thine end, saith the Lord,
that thy children shall come again to their own border.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Surely after that I was turned, I repented;
and after that I was instructed, I smote upon my thigh:
I was ashamed, yea, even confounded,
because I did bear the reproach of my youth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Set thee up waymarks, make thee high heaps:
set thine heart toward the highway,
even the way which thou wentest:
turn again, O virgin of Israel,
turn again to these thy cities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long wilt thou go about,
O thou backsliding daughter?
for the Lord hath created a new thing in the earth,
A woman shall compass a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; As yet they shall use this speech in the land of Judah and in the cities thereof, when I shall bring again their captivity; The Lord bless thee, O habitation of justice, and mountain of holiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there shall dwell in Judah itself, and in all the cities thereof together, husbandmen, and they that go forth with flocks.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten a sour grape, and the children’s teeth are set on edge.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: but this shall be the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel; After those days, saith the Lord, I will put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts; and will be their God, and they shall be my people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall teach no more every man his neighbour, and every man his brother, saying, Know the Lord: for they shall all know me, from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith the Lord: for I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: So Hanameel mine uncle’s son came to me in the court of the prison according to the word of the Lord, and said unto me, Buy my field, I pray thee, that is in Anathoth, which is in the country of Benjamin: for the right of inheritance is thine, and the redemption is thine; buy it for thyself. Then I knew that this was the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I bought the field of Hanameel my uncle’s son, that was in Anathoth, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I subscribed the evidence, and sealed it, and took witnesses, and weighed him the money in the balances.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I took the evidence of the purchase, both that which was sealed according to the law and custom, and that which was open:
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And I charged Baruch before them, saying,
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; Houses and fields and vineyards shall be possessed again in this land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when I had delivered the evidence of the purchase unto Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed unto the Lord, saying,

speaker: Narrator

text: thou shewest lovingkindness unto thousands, and recompensest the iniquity of the fathers into the bosom of their children after them: the Great, the Mighty God, the Lord of hosts, is his name,

text: great in counsel, and mighty in work: for thine eyes are open upon all the ways of the sons of men: to give every one according to his ways, and according to the fruit of his doings:
speaker: Narrator

text: which hast set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, even unto this day, and in Israel, and among other men; and hast made thee a name, as at this day;
speaker: Narrator

text: and hast brought forth thy people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs, and with wonders, and with a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm, and with great terror;
speaker: Narrator

text: and hast given them this land, which thou didst swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they came in, and possessed it; but they obeyed not thy voice, neither walked in thy law; they have done nothing of all that thou commandedst them to do: therefore thou hast caused all this evil to come upon them:
speaker: Narrator

text: behold the mounts, they are come unto the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans, that fight against it, because of the sword, and of the famine, and of the pestilence: and what thou hast spoken is come to pass; and, behold, thou seest it.

text: And thou hast said unto me, O Lord God, Buy thee the field for money, and take witnesses; for the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came the word of the Lord unto Jeremiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all flesh: is there any thing too hard for me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Chaldeans, that fight against this city, shall come and set fire on this city, and burn it with the houses, upon whose roofs they have offered incense unto Baal, and poured out drink offerings unto other gods, to provoke me to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have only done evil before me from their youth: for the children of Israel have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, saith the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this city hath been to me as a provocation of mine anger and of my fury from the day that they built it even unto this day; that I should remove it from before my face,
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator
